protocol_name: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
protocol_name_html: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
description: Please contact Dr. Steven Wilhelm (wilhelm@utk.edu) for additional information regarding this protocol.
manuscript_citation: Sadhu MJ, Bloom JS, Day L, Kruglyak L. CRISPR-directed mitotic recombination enables genetic mapping without crosses. Science (New York, NY). 2016;352(6289):1113-1116. doi:10.1126/science.aaf5124.

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

authors: Meru J. Sadhu, Joshua S. Bloom, Laura Day, Leonid Kruglyak
guidelines:
Mutations and off-target effects
The method has various safeguards against the effects of mutations and off-target cutting. Most importantly, unlike in many uses of CRISPR to create DSBs, the rate of indel formation at the DSB site should be low, as LOH occurs through high fidelity HR, rather than error-prone non-homologous end joining. In the LOH process, the targeted cut site is gene-converted to the PAM-less allele, abolishing further cutting by Cas9. Off-target LOH events are uncovered in our whole-genome genotyping. Finally, in genetic mapping using LOH events a positive signal would typically require multiple different recombination events to generate similar phenotypes, so gRNA-specific off-target effects or mutations should not produce false positive signals.

We checked whether the LOH process introduced mutations at the targeted cut site by Sanger sequencing in 72 independent LOH lines, and did not observe any mutations. We amplified genomic DNA in an interval surrounding the cut sites of 78 individuals, sampled from both the Chr 7L panel and the manganese fine-mapping panel. The PCR products were Sanger sequenced from both ends; we obtained high quality sequence data from both reads for 72 of the 78 individuals. The resulting data were analyzed using the R package SangerseqR (34) to make homozygous as well as heterozygous base calls. Heterozygous calls were made with a cutoff of 0.25 for the ratio of intensity for the secondary basecall relative to the intensity of the primary basecall (default is 0.33). Mutation calls were made if a position had an observed mutation in both of the paired sequencing reads.

 

Power calculations
We investigated the relationship between statistical power, effect size, and proximity of a QTL to the telomere, in the panel of 384 LOH strains with LOH targeted uniformly across Chr 7L. With this panel design we expect power to detect a QTL to be highest near the telomere and lower for QTL near the centromere. Smaller fractions of lines will be homozygous for polymorphic positions near the centromere than for polymorphic positions near the telomere. We simulated a single additive QTL at each variant site on Chr 7L using our observed genotype data, by generating a simulated phenotype for each line drawn from a normal distribution with variance 1 and mean 0, β, or 2β, depending on the line’s genotype at the variant (homozygous BY, heterozygous BY/RM, or homozygous RM). Simulated phenotypes were generated for the 384 LOH lines while varying the simulated QTL’s β from 0.25 to 5, at each of 2000 BY/RM polymorphic positions along Chr 7L, 100 times. Heritability (h2) was calculated as the ratio of var(g) to var(p). QTL mapping was performed as described above. Power was calculated at each QTL position and effect size as the fraction of simulations out of 100 with a LOD greater than 3 at the simulated QTL position.

 

Data deposition
Code and data can be found at https://github.com/joshsbloom/crispr_loh; sequencing data is deposited at the Sequence Read Archive under accession SRP072527.

components.data: Generate gRNA plasmids targeting various sites on Chr 7L that are variable between BY and RM with Gibson Assembly using plasmid p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t provided by George Church.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Generate gRNA plasmids targeting various sites on Chr 7L that are variable between BY and RM with Gibson Assembly using plasmid p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t provided by George Church.

components.data: Amplify PCR products from p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t with primers that introduce desired 20 bp targeting site sequences. These PCR products are Gibson Assembled into the apprroximately 6000 bp ClaI/KpnI digestion product of p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t. All polymorphisms targeted change an NGG PAM to a sequence other than NGG or NAG.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Amplify PCR products from p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t with primers that introduce desired 20 bp targeting site sequences. These PCR products are Gibson Assembled into the apprroximately 6000 bp ClaI/KpnI digestion product of p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t. All polymorphisms targeted change an NGG PAM to a sequence other than NGG or NAG.

components.data:
The strains used in this study are listed below. The parent strain used for BY was

BY4742 (MATα leu2Δ his3Δ ura3Δ lys2Δ), and for RM was YLK2442 (MATa leu2Δ his3Δ::NatMX ura3Δ ho::HygMX AMN1BY).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The strains used in this study are listed below. The parent strain used for BY was

BY4742 (MATα leu2Δ his3Δ ura3Δ lys2Δ), and for RM was YLK2442 (MATa leu2Δ his3Δ::NatMX ura3Δ ho::HygMX AMN1BY).

components.data: Use standard lithium acetate procedures for transformations of yeast.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use standard lithium acetate procedures for transformations of yeast.

components.data: Facilitate isolation of cells that have undergone LOH, HXK2, which resides 25 kb from the Chr 7L telomere, should be tagged with GFP on either the BY or RM chromosome, by transferring the GFP tag of HXK2 from the GFP-tagged collection into the BY/RM hybrid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Facilitate isolation of cells that have undergone LOH, HXK2, which resides 25 kb from the Chr 7L telomere, should be tagged with GFP on either the BY or RM chromosome, by transferring the GFP tag of HXK2 from the GFP-tagged collection into the BY/RM hybrid.

components.data: Place a KanMX selectable marker in cis on the appropriate Chr 7R homolog (downstream of ADE6) to allow selection against cells that had lost the GFP through loss of the entire Chr 7.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a KanMX selectable marker in cis on the appropriate Chr 7R homolog (downstream of ADE6) to allow selection against cells that had lost the GFP through loss of the entire Chr 7.

components.data: Introduce Cas9 on a plasmid (p415-GalL-Cas9-CYClt, also provided by George Church) to produce YLK3219 and YLK3220.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Introduce Cas9 on a plasmid (p415-GalL-Cas9-CYClt, also provided by George Church) to produce YLK3219 and YLK3220.

components.data: Transform these strains with the gRNA plasmids whose construction is described above, and grow overnight in defined media, after which GFP(-) cells are isolated by flow cytometry (FCM) using a Bio-Rad S3e apparatus from Bio-Rad Laboratories, Hercules, CA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transform these strains with the gRNA plasmids whose construction is described above, and grow overnight in defined media, after which GFP(-) cells are isolated by flow cytometry (FCM) using a Bio-Rad S3e apparatus from Bio-Rad Laboratories, Hercules, CA.

components.data: In this study, approximately 10% of cells with gal-induced Cas9 showed loss of GFP, with some variation dependent on the gRNA used. If this occurs, plate the sorted fraction on YPD+G418, and manually screen the resultant colonies to confirm GFP loss.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In this study, approximately 10% of cells with gal-induced Cas9 showed loss of GFP, with some variation dependent on the gRNA used. If this occurs, plate the sorted fraction on YPD+G418, and manually screen the resultant colonies to confirm GFP loss.

components.data: Pick 384GFP(-) colonies (approximately 4 from each gRNA) into 900 µL YPD in 96-well 2 mL deep-well plates, and grown 2 days without shaking at 30°C to stationary phase.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick 384GFP(-) colonies (approximately 4 from each gRNA) into 900 µL YPD in 96-well 2 mL deep-well plates, and grown 2 days without shaking at 30°C to stationary phase.

components.data: Freeze 100 µL of saturated culture of each line  at -80°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Freeze 100 µL of saturated culture of each line  at -80°C

components.data: Extract DNA from the rest for genotyping, with the EX-96 Tissue DNA Kit from Omega Bio-tek, Norcross, GA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract DNA from the rest for genotyping, with the EX-96 Tissue DNA Kit from Omega Bio-tek, Norcross, GA.

components.data: For genotyping the panel targeting all of Chr 7L, construct whole-genome Illumina sequencing libraries as described in Bloom, et al.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For genotyping the panel targeting all of Chr 7L, construct whole-genome Illumina sequencing libraries as described in Bloom, et al.

components.data: Pool libraries from lines into two batches of 192, each of which should be sequenced on a Miseq Sequencer from Illumina, San Diego, CA with PE150 runs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pool libraries from lines into two batches of 192, each of which should be sequenced on a Miseq Sequencer from Illumina, San Diego, CA with PE150 runs.

components.data: Trim the reads with adapter sequences using trimmomatic 0.32, and align to the reference sacCer3 genome using bwa mem.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Trim the reads with adapter sequences using trimmomatic 0.32, and align to the reference sacCer3 genome using bwa mem.

components.data: Use the GATK v 3.4 UnifiedGenotyper to call variants at high-quality variant sites that were previously identified between the parent strains.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use the GATK v 3.4 UnifiedGenotyper to call variants at high-quality variant sites that were previously identified between the parent strains.

components.data: Using custom R scripts, extract the genotype likelihoods for the homozygous BY, heterozygous, and homozygous RM states  from each sample at each known variant site between the parent strains. Filter the low quality sites.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using custom R scripts, extract the genotype likelihoods for the homozygous BY, heterozygous, and homozygous RM states  from each sample at each known variant site between the parent strains. Filter the low quality sites.

components.data: Use a hidden Markov model to calculate the posterior probability at each variant site in the genome that a line is homozygous BY, heterozygous, or homozygous RM. Variant sites should be called one of these three states by choosing the state with the highest posterior probability.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use a hidden Markov model to calculate the posterior probability at each variant site in the genome that a line is homozygous BY, heterozygous, or homozygous RM. Variant sites should be called one of these three states by choosing the state with the highest posterior probability.

components.data: Genotype the lines from the fine-mapping panel in the same way, except that a single pool of the libraries of 384 lines should be sequenced once on a Miseq Sequencer with PE150 reads and again with an additional PE150 rapid-run flow cell on a Hiseq 4000 Sequencing System by Illumina.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Genotype the lines from the fine-mapping panel in the same way, except that a single pool of the libraries of 384 lines should be sequenced once on a Miseq Sequencer with PE150 reads and again with an additional PE150 rapid-run flow cell on a Hiseq 4000 Sequencing System by Illumina.
Merge BAM files for downstream analysis.

components.data: Carry out an analysis on 358 lines with genotypes that passed quality control filters.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carry out an analysis on 358 lines with genotypes that passed quality control filters.

components.data: Re-genotype select lines with called recombination events close to the called causal polymorphisms using Sanger sequencing at polymorphisms in the QTL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-genotype select lines with called recombination events close to the called causal polymorphisms using Sanger sequencing at polymorphisms in the QTL.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 22 of CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name_html: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.annotation: In this study, genotyping uncovered lines with both simple recombination events and complex recombination events featuring a mix of gene conversion and recombination.
source_data.thread_text: In this study, genotyping uncovered lines with both simple recombination events and complex recombination events featuring a mix of gene conversion and recombination.
source_data.body: In this study, genotyping uncovered lines with both simple recombination events and complex recombination events featuring a mix of gene conversion and recombination.

components.data: For determining linkage, reduce the variant site set to only include variant sites at least 300 bp apart from each other. The cM distance between a given pair of variants should be calculated as the percentage of chromosomes with a nonparental genotype. For the LOH panel, linkage should be calculated on haplotype inferred from the diploid genotypes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For determining linkage, reduce the variant site set to only include variant sites at least 300 bp apart from each other. The cM distance between a given pair of variants should be calculated as the percentage of chromosomes with a nonparental genotype. For the LOH panel, linkage should be calculated on haplotype inferred from the diploid genotypes.

components.data: Thaw the 384 frozen lines, array randomly into two 384-well plates, and then phenotype as previou
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thaw the 384 frozen lines, array randomly into two 384-well plates, and then phenotype as previou

components.data: Pin the lines briefly from frozen stocks to liquid YPD, grow for two days at 30ºC without shaking, and then pin onto agar plates with a custom pinning robot from S&P Robotics, Toronto, Canada.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pin the lines briefly from frozen stocks to liquid YPD, grow for two days at 30ºC without shaking, and then pin onto agar plates with a custom pinning robot from S&P Robotics, Toronto, Canada.

components.data: Pictures were taken of colony growth after 48 hrs.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pictures were taken of colony growth after 48 hrs.

components.data: Measure using functions from the EBImage R Package.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Measure using functions from the EBImage R Package.

components.data: Perform minimal filtering to remove measurements affected by pinning or contamination artifacts.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform minimal filtering to remove measurements affected by pinning or contamination artifacts.

components.data: Remove colonies at the edge of the plate if there is a colony with a radii significantly different than the radii of colonies on the rest of the plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove colonies at the edge of the plate if there is a colony with a radii significantly different than the radii of colonies on the rest of the plate.

components.data: Phenotype the two randomized plates of 384 LOH lines, and average colony measurements across the two replicates for downstream analysis. In addition, phenotype the 768 segregant lines from the previous linkage analysis between the same parental strains in parallel, for the same traits, to allow controlled comparison.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Phenotype the two randomized plates of 384 LOH lines, and average colony measurements across the two replicates for downstream analysis. In addition, phenotype the 768 segregant lines from the previous linkage analysis between the same parental strains in parallel, for the same traits, to allow controlled comparison.

source_data.annotation: Conditions to test: 92 mM calcium chloride, 6 mM copper sulfate, 1.26 mM diamide, 0.25% DMSO, 2% lactate, 91.7 mM lithium chloride, 10 mM manganese sulfate, 2.5 mg/mL neomycin, 0.1% sodium dodecyl sulfate, 2% trehalose, and growth at 15ºC or 30°C on YPD.

components.data: Use the same methods as described above to generate and phenotype the fine-mapping panel targeting a region of Chr 7L, but with all lines derived from 3 gRNAs as shown in supplementary table 1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use the same methods as described above to generate and phenotype the fine-mapping panel targeting a region of Chr 7L, but with all lines derived from 3 gRNAs as shown in supplementary table 1.

components.data: Detect QTL using an additive linear model with genotypes of homozygous BY, heterozygous BY/RM, and homozygous RM coded as 0, 1, and 2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Detect QTL using an additive linear model with genotypes of homozygous BY, heterozygous BY/RM, and homozygous RM coded as 0, 1, and 2.

components.data: Convert the R2 from the model to a LOD score as descrived in Lynch and Walsh 1998.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Convert the R2 from the model to a LOD score as descrived in Lynch and Walsh 1998.

components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate 5% family-wise error rate significance thresholds per trait using 1000 permutations of phenotypes to strain labels.

components.data: Map the QTLs in the panel of 768 by/RM segregants as in Bloom et al. Perform all QTL scans on Chr 7L only.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Map the QTLs in the panel of 768 by/RM segregants as in Bloom et al. Perform all QTL scans on Chr 7L only.

components.data: Do variant replacements using CRISPR to cut near the site targeted for mutation, while providing a repair template carrying the desired mutation embedded in a >100 bp region homologous to the targeted site.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do variant replacements using CRISPR to cut near the site targeted for mutation, while providing a repair template carrying the desired mutation embedded in a >100 bp region homologous to the targeted site.

source_data.annotation: If the desired mutation did not itself disrupt the PAM site used to target Cas9, the repair template was designed to additionally carry a PAM-disrupting synonymous mutation. All such PAM-disruping synonymous mutations were also introduced individually, as controls.
source_data.thread_text: If the desired mutation did not itself disrupt the PAM site used to target Cas9, the repair template was designed to additionally carry a PAM-disrupting synonymous mutation. All such PAM-disruping synonymous mutations were also introduced individually, as controls.

components.data: Synthesize the DNA fragments carrying the desired gRNA as well as the appropriate repair template as gBlocks (Integrated DNA Technologies, Coralville, IA), and then clone into p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t by Gibson Assembly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Synthesize the DNA fragments carrying the desired gRNA as well as the appropriate repair template as gBlocks (Integrated DNA Technologies, Coralville, IA), and then clone into p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t by Gibson Assembly.

components.data: Introduce changes in a BY strain with a nej1Δ mutation, such that it lacks non-homologous end-joining activity, to bias the repair process towards homologous recombination using the repair template.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Introduce changes in a BY strain with a nej1Δ mutation, such that it lacks non-homologous end-joining activity, to bias the repair process towards homologous recombination using the repair template.

components.data: Transform this strain with the same Cas9-carrying plasmid as above to produce YLK3221.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transform this strain with the same Cas9-carrying plasmid as above to produce YLK3221.

components.data: Transform YLK3221 with the plasmids described above, and then grow overnight at 30°C in defined media with galactose as a carbon source to stimulate Cas9 activity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transform YLK3221 with the plasmids described above, and then grow overnight at 30°C in defined media with galactose as a carbon source to stimulate Cas9 activity.

components.data: Plate cultures at low density to allow growth of single colonies on glucose media to arrest Cas9 activity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plate cultures at low density to allow growth of single colonies on glucose media to arrest Cas9 activity.

components.data: Pick 22 to 32 colonies from each variant replacement experiment into 2 mL deep-well plates and grow and process as above for DNA extraction, with the genotyping done through Sanger sequencing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick 22 to 32 colonies from each variant replacement experiment into 2 mL deep-well plates and grow and process as above for DNA extraction, with the genotyping done through Sanger sequencing.

components.data: Lines without mutations uncovered in the genotyping should be used as unmutagenized BY controls; there were 106 total in this study.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Lines without mutations uncovered in the genotyping should be used as unmutagenized BY controls; there were 106 total in this study.

components.data: Phenotype as previously descived, with the two randomized 384-well plates also containing 64 unmutagenized RM parent lines for comparison.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Phenotype as previously descived, with the two randomized 384-well plates also containing 64 unmutagenized RM parent lines for comparison.

components.data: Start with a diploid yeast strain formed by mating a genetically diverse pair of yeast strains with known genotypes. The diploid yeast strain that is used should be autoptrophic for uracil and leucine.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Start with a diploid yeast strain formed by mating a genetically diverse pair of yeast strains with known genotypes. The diploid yeast strain that is used should be autoptrophic for uracil and leucine.

components.data: Select a chromosome arm for targeted LOH. Knock in a TDH3-driven GFP that is amplified from YPW1180 from the Wittkopp lab, heterozygously, at the end of the chromosome, using a standard lithium acetate yeast transformation protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Select a chromosome arm for targeted LOH. Knock in a TDH3-driven GFP that is amplified from YPW1180 from the Wittkopp lab, heterozygously, at the end of the chromosome, using a standard lithium acetate yeast transformation protocol.

components.data: Perform PCR to check which chromosome arm was tagged with GFP in the resulting colonies.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform PCR to check which chromosome arm was tagged with GFP in the resulting colonies.

components.data: Pick a pair of strains, one with each chromosome tagged.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pick a pair of strains, one with each chromosome tagged.

components.data: Transform in p415-GalL-Cas9-CYC1t, also using a standard lithium acetate yeast transformation protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transform in p415-GalL-Cas9-CYC1t, also using a standard lithium acetate yeast transformation protocol.

components.data: Select gRNAs target sites evenly spaced around the area of the chromosome arm that you want to create LOH events in: 20 base sequences, followed in the genome by NGG. An important constrain is that each site should only be present on one of the two haplotypes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Select gRNAs target sites evenly spaced around the area of the chromosome arm that you want to create LOH events in: 20 base sequences, followed in the genome by NGG. An important constrain is that each site should only be present on one of the two haplotypes.

components.data: For each gRNA you wish to generate, design primers of the formgcagtgaaagataaatgatcNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNgttttagagctagaaatagc and ctatagggcgaattgggtac, where the italicized sequence matches the desired targeting sequence, and use them to PCR fragments from p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For each gRNA you wish to generate, design primers of the formgcagtgaaagataaatgatcNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNgttttagagctagaaatagc and ctatagggcgaattgggtac, where the italicized sequence matches the desired targeting sequence, and use them to PCR fragments from p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t.

source_data.annotation: p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t can be found and purchased at https://www.addgene.org/43803/
source_data.thread_text: p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t can be found and purchased at https://www.addgene.org/43803/
source_data.body: p426-SNR52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t can be found and purchased at https://www.addgene.org/43803/

components.data: Miniprep p426-SNr52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t from dam- dcm- bacteria (NEB). Do this step so that the plasmid is free of DNA methylation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Miniprep p426-SNr52p-gRNA.CAN1.Y-SUP4t from dam- dcm- bacteria (NEB). Do this step so that the plasmid is free of DNA methylation.

components.data: Digest with ClaI and EagI and gel purify.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Digest with ClaI and EagI and gel purify.

components.data: Use a Gibson Assembly protocol to clone the PCR above into the digested plasmid above.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use a Gibson Assembly protocol to clone the PCR above into the digested plasmid above.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name_html: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.annotation: You can find the Gibson Assembly protocol at https://www.protocols.io/view/Gibson-Assembly-Master-Mix-Assembly-E2611-imsupm
source_data.thread_text: You can find the Gibson Assembly protocol at https://www.protocols.io/view/Gibson-Assembly-Master-Mix-Assembly-E2611-imsupm
source_data.body: You can find the Gibson Assembly protocol at https://www.protocols.io/view/Gibson-Assembly-Master-Mix-Assembly-E2611-imsupm

components.data: Miniprep and sequence to confirm plasmid sequence.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Miniprep and sequence to confirm plasmid sequence.

components.data: Transform your gRNA plasmids into the yeast strain above.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transform your gRNA plasmids into the yeast strain above.

components.data: Start a 2 mL 30ºC overnight culture of each gRNA-containing strain in YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% galactose yeast media. Use a GFP(-) strain as a negative control, and a strain without a gRNA grown in media supplemented to allow its growth, or with an empty URA plasmid as a positive control.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Start a 2 mL 30ºC overnight culture of each gRNA-containing strain in YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% galactose yeast media. Use a GFP(-) strain as a negative control, and a strain without a gRNA grown in media supplemented to allow its growth, or with an empty URA plasmid as a positive control.

components.data: After 24 hrs, dilute to an OD600 of 0.1 in 2 mL YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% galactose yeast media, and grow 4 hrs at 30ºC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 24 hrs, dilute to an OD600 of 0.1 in 2 mL YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% galactose yeast media, and grow 4 hrs at 30ºC.

components.data: Pellet 1 mL of cells in a tabletop centrifuge for 15 sec at full speed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pellet 1 mL of cells in a tabletop centrifuge for 15 sec at full speed.

components.data: Resuspend pellets in 1 mL phosphate buffered saline.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend pellets in 1 mL phosphate buffered saline.

components.data: Check fluorescence of samples via Flow Cytometer. Use the positive and negative conrtols to set the gates on the FCM to isolate GFP(-) cells without isolating GFP(+) cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check fluorescence of samples via Flow Cytometer. Use the positive and negative conrtols to set the gates on the FCM to isolate GFP(-) cells without isolating GFP(+) cells.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 61 of CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name_html: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.annotation: If using the optional RFP, set gates to isolate RFP(+) cells without isolating RFP(-) cells.
source_data.thread_text: If using the optional RFP, set gates to isolate RFP(+) cells without isolating RFP(-) cells.
source_data.body: If using the optional RFP, set gates to isolate RFP(+) cells without isolating RFP(-) cells.

components.data: Sort the GAL-induced LOH cells by sorting for GFP(-) cells from each gRNA-containing culture.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sort the GAL-induced LOH cells by sorting for GFP(-) cells from each gRNA-containing culture.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 62 of CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.protocol_name_html: CRISPR-Directed Mitotic Recombination Enables Genetic Mapping Without Crosses
source_data.annotation: Alternatively, you can plate the cells at ~200-250 cells/plate. You should be able to identify GFP(-) colonies with any apparatus that visualizes fluorescencce on plates.
source_data.thread_text: Alternatively, you can plate the cells at ~200-250 cells/plate. You should be able to identify GFP(-) colonies with any apparatus that visualizes fluorescencce on plates.
source_data.body: Alternatively, you can plate the cells at ~200-250 cells/plate. You should be able to identify GFP(-) colonies with any apparatus that visualizes fluorescencce on plates.

components.data: Plate 50+ GFP(-) cells from each culture on YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% glucose plates.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plate 50+ GFP(-) cells from each culture on YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% glucose plates.

components.data: Once they have grown colonies, pick the desired number of colonies, and grow them in 96-well deep-well plates in YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% glucose at 30ºC for 2 days.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once they have grown colonies, pick the desired number of colonies, and grow them in 96-well deep-well plates in YNB+CSM-LEU-URA+ 2% glucose at 30ºC for 2 days.

components.data: Save 100 uL in 96-well plates at -80ºC with 100 uL of 40% glycerol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Save 100 uL in 96-well plates at -80ºC with 100 uL of 40% glycerol.

components.data: Isolate genomic DNA from the remaining samples with the Qiagen DNeasy 96 Blood & Tissue Kit, with their yeast genomic DNA isolation protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Isolate genomic DNA from the remaining samples with the Qiagen DNeasy 96 Blood & Tissue Kit, with their yeast genomic DNA isolation protocol.

source_data.reagent_name: QIAgen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit, 50 rxn

components.data: Use an Illumina Nextera protocol to generate sequencing libraries, with Illumina's 96-plex indexing. Sequence with 150 paired-end sequencing on an Illumina HiSeq.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use an Illumina Nextera protocol to generate sequencing libraries, with Illumina's 96-plex indexing. Sequence with 150 paired-end sequencing on an Illumina HiSeq.
